title: In a CA chapter 7 bankruptcy, can I use my 29 yr old daughter as a dependent for means test household size? No job, I support
question: So she is 29 and presently and for a while has not been working. I pay for all her daily needs but don't / can't claim on taxes. What would be the trustee response from listing her as an added dependent and thereby increasing household size for means test purposes?
answers: Is there a compelling reason why you MUST file BK now or might it make sense to wait 3 mos, claim daughter on 18 return and file after? Like other counsel says, it is not imperative to have claimed the person on dependent on return especially if you can show she has no income, lives with you and you have been supporting her and likely will for an extended time. Will the household income increase in the next 3 mos? Are you certain that you cant pass the meams test even without claiming her? Means test takes practice and it is part math, part art, knowing how your local trustee office interprets certain expenses is one trick. Sometimes changes and passage of time can help a debtor pass the test. In my humble opinion we are worth the expense, sometimes lawyers file BK and they too hire BK lawyers instead of DIY.

Typically, claiming a dependent on your tax return shows the trustee viable evidence that you in fact had a dependent prior to filing bankruptcy. However, just because you did not claim a person as a dependent on your previously filed tax return does not necessarily mean that person is not a dependent of yours.

However, the bankruptcy code looks to similar factors for who a dependent is as does the IRS. There are various things to examine to make an argument that the person living with you is part of your household and a dependent of yours. It is really best for you to discuss this with a bankruptcy attorney who can explain the arguments and options with you.

You can find many good bankruptcy attorneys here on AVVO.

I agree with atty Firth. A lot depends on the trustee assigned to your case. Good luck.

Remember, BK is more than checking boxes on forms you find online. Find/consult/hire a lawyer using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it.

Because the bankruptcy process can be handled entirely by phone, email and fax, there is no need to personally visit the lawyer’s office unless you want to. Don’t be limited by the location of the BK lawyers you select.

What does your bankruptcy lawyer say? If you don't have one, historical evidence suggests that you are doomed to failure. If you are paying your daughter support, can prove it, and expect this to continue for the foreseeable future, go for it. You have a fifty/fifty shot with the trustee.
